snippet: After Asian stocks underperformed other markets late last year, some investment advisers see a buying opportunity.
abstract: Stock markets in Asia have performed worse than other major regions during the fourth quarter of 2011, causing some investment advisers to see an opportunity to buy into Asian funds; experts attribute the poor performance to global concerns about development undermining the strong economic progress the region has made in recent years and to a general sense of unease and desire to limit risk.
lead_paragraph: After Asian stocks underperformed other markets late last year, some investment advisers see a buying opportunity.

headline.seo: As Asia Slows Down, Investors May Still Want to Dive In
headline.main: Slower Growth in Asia May Yield Bargains
headline.print_headline: Slower Growth in Asia May Yield Bargains
